content:
In this contribution, I define a basic notion of a period of a word (meaning List), and via few lemmas head directly towards the Periodicity Lemma which is a basic nontrivial claim about periods (aka the Fine-Wilf theorem).

This is part of a larger project concerning multiperiodic words (generalizing the Fine-Wilf to more periods). The current PR is a minimal starting point, in order to see how well the topic (and my proving skills) fit mathlib. (The construction of the "most free" word with given periods, as well as the proof of the bound optimality is omited for now.)
Is there any future for this PR? Just to have a rough idea what to expect.
There's 431 PRs currently waiting for review, and yours is one of them
